comment.author: 69772308@N05
comment._content: Roll of Honour - Brunel John Nash Service number: 702 Rank: Private Unit: 10th Battalion (Infantry) Service: Australian Army Conflict: 1914-1918 Date of death: 2 May 1915 Cause of death: Killed in action Cemetery or memorial details: Lone Pine Memorial, Gallipoli, Turkey War Grave Register notes: NASH, Pte. Brunel John, 702. 10th Bn. Killed in action 2nd May, 1915. Age 27. Son of Joseph George and Emma Maria Nash, of 15, Charles St., Norwood, South Australia. Native of Adelaide. 32. Source: AWM145 Roll of Honour cards, 1914-1918 War, Army www.awm.gov.au/research/people/roll_of_honour/person.asp?...

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Brunel John Nash Birth: 1887 3rd child of Joseph George Nash Birth: 1853 Birmingham, Warwick, England Marriage: 26 JAN 1882 Adelaide, South Australia, Australia Death: 02 FEB 1909 Adelaide, South Australia, Australia Emma Maria Barrow Birth: 19 FEB 1859 Adelaide, South Australia, Australia Death: 24 AUG 1939 Adelaide, South Australia, Australia Family group record at www.familysearch.org - Source: IGI www.familysearch.org/Eng/Search/igi/family_group_record.a... Emma Maria Barrow dau of John Barrow 1813-1903 born in Seaton, Rutlandshire England trove.nla.gov.au/ndp/del/article/4937363 Other genealogical data boards.ancestry.com/thread.aspx?o=80&m=3051.29.1.1.1&... including: Brunel John Nash Born 29/5/1887 Parkside SA reg no Ade 396/338 Died 2/5/1915 KIA - Turkey Buried Lone Pine Memorial Turkey

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: As found on Australian newspaper sites here trove.nla.gov.au/newspaper/result?l-title=|34&q=Brunel+John+Nash (The Advertiser (Adelaide, SA : 1889 - 1931) Tuesday 1 September 1914 p 8) THE MILITARY CAMP. MORE SOLDIERS AT MORPHETTVILLE. LATEST BULLETIN OF NAMES. Brunel John Nash is one of maybe 40 men in F Company (The Advertiser (Adelaide, SA : 1889 - 1931) Tuesday 22 June 1915 p 8) The Roll of Honor Biographical Particulars Private Brunel J. Nash Private Brunel J. Nash, who is reported missing, is the younger son of Mrs. Nash, of Charles-street, Norwood, and the late Mr. J. G. Nash. He was educated at Palteney-street School and St. Peter's Col- lege, and subsequently followed his father's calling as an engineer in the Government service. He made a great many friends in the service, as he also did on the football and cricket field. He was among the first to enlist. He joined the 10th Infantry. Mrs. Nash is naturally anxious for further information. Death notice (The Advertiser (Adelaide, SA : 1889 - 1931) Tuesday 31 October 1916 p 6 Family Notices) Nickname was Brue (The Advertiser (Adelaide, SA : 1889 - 1931) Wednesday 2 May 1917 p 6 Family Notices)

comment.author: 64752931@N08
comment._content: I've seen and admired your beautiful photo in :LA BOHEME / THE BOHEMIAN

comment.author: 39899280@N00
comment._content: His service record/personnel dossier is in the National Archives of Australia. It has been digitised and may be viewed online at no charge (www.naa.gov.au/) Series: B2455 Control symbol: NASH BRUNEL JOHN Item barcode: 7994115

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Digitized service record found at recordsearch.naa.gov.au/scripts/Imagine.asp?B=7994115 indicates that, contrary to the Biographical Particulars outlined in The Advertiser (Adelaide, SA) above, Brunel John Nash served a 5-year apprenticeship to become a fitter and turner by trade. Just to point out that the description "engineer" was used quite loosely at the time and arguably till more recent times - we would use the term "engineer" to indicate a person registered as a professional engineer today.
